segments.text: One bottle of perfume and a watch .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Oh ... I go to see my sister twice a year or so .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Twice a year ? How long has your sister lived in Boston ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I see , that's a long time.How much was the watch ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I can't remember , but I've got the receipt somewhere.Would you like to see it ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Yes , I'd like to see the receipt.Oh ! I see you bough the watch last week .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Yes.Does that mean I'll have to pay duty on it ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Yes , I'm afraid you will.Altogether on the watch and the perfume you owe me seven pounds .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Ok.Here you are.Is that all right now ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Yes , that's fine . I hope you enjoyed your stay in Boston ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Yes , I did . I had a fine time .
segments.speaker: S2
